docs.lead_paragraph: The market for corporate social software must be getting big: the purveyors are following each others' strategies, and talking each other down. Jive Software, the largest and most successful of the companies trying to bring a little Facebook-style communication to the workplace, just released a 30-day free trial version of its product, along with a ''Jive Anywhere'' feature that will make it useable from anywhere on the Web.
docs.abstract: Bits blog notes the market for corporate social networking software is getting bigger, as Jive Software tries to bring Facebook-style communications to the workplace. (M)
docs.snippet: The market for corporate social software must be getting big: the purveyors are following each others' strategies, and talking each other down.     Jive Software, the largest and most successful of the companies trying to bring a little Facebook-s...

headline.main: In-House Kind Of 'Facebooks' Gain in Popularity

docs.lead_paragraph: The technologist and the marketing executive who co-founded Palm Computing in 1992 are starting a new company that plans to license software technologies based on a novel theory of how the mind works. Jeff Hawkins and Donna Dubinsky will remain involved with what is now called PalmOne, but on Thursday they plan to announce the creation of Numenta, a technology development firm that will conduct research in an effort to extend Mr. Hawkins's theories. Those ideas were initially sketched out last year in his book ''On Intelligence: How a New Understanding of the Brain Will Lead to the Creation of Truly Intelligent Machines,'' co-written with Sandra Blakeslee, who also writes for The New York Times.
docs.snippet: The technologist and the marketing executive who co-founded Palm Computing are starting a new company to license software technologies based on a theory of how the mind works....

headline.main: A New Company to Focus On Artificial Intelligence

docs.lead_paragraph: Volunteers met for the End of Term Presidential Harvest, an effort to archive pages on federal websites that may be at risk of disappearing.
docs.abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column spotlights End of Term Archive, volunteer project that captures and saves federal websites at end of presidential administrations, and makes them available to public; task, spearheaded by group of  university, government and nonprofit libraries, takes on special urgency after presidential election of 2016, especially for sites dedicated to topics like global warming toward which Pres-elect Donald J Trump and his allies have expressed contempt.
docs.snippet: Volunteers met for the End of Term Presidential Harvest, an effort to archive pages on federal websites that may be at risk of disappearing....

docs.lead_paragraph: Efforts to turn people away from the Taliban included an unusual public trial. But will this experiment with transparent justice be repeated?
docs.abstract: Carol Giacomo Editorial Observer praises efforts of Musa Khan Akbarzada, governor of Ghazni Province, who has made attempts to make government more responsive and lessen the Taliban's appeal and power; questions whether Akbarzada's limited success can be replicated across the country.
